results.title: Battle prelude
results.brief_description: With commentary by Wilfred Thomas, this is a record of the Australian Army Jungle-Training School at Canungra in Queensland during World War II. No other credits available.

results.title: The Battle of Wangapore
results.brief_description: In this satirical animation British troops under a typical Colonel Blimp test the turbanned and rebellious riff-raff from over the border and all with a stiff sense of propriety. The story tracks back to the good old days on the North West Frontier of India. An example of animation technique as used by an amateur production group. Animation by Richard Horn and Ken Clark. (See also Title Code 006110 “Let battle begin” for the history of the making of the cartoon.)

results.title: Battle for the Bulge
results.brief_description: Uses location filming and historical footage to document the ‘Battle for the Bulge’, the last big German offensive in World War II. Portrays the heroism, as well as the confusion and humiliation, that characterised both the Allied and German troops.

results.title: Batman's village
results.creator_credit: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia
results.brief_description: A picturesque view of Melbourne city interspersed with factual information on its history and the key figures involved in its establishment. Inner city streets, buildings and botanical gardens are shown.

results.title: Bate's car: sweet as a nut
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low, Michael Rubbo and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A delightful film encounter with a man who found his own substitute for gasoline in barnyard manure. Mr. Bate is an inventor, a classic combination of single-minded knowhow and practical dreamer. But his discovery is real enough. The film shows how his homemade digester does turn manure into potent methane gas to power his auto. And for good measure he demonstrates his latest energy machine - a bicycle powered by the bumps on the road. Award: Yugoslavia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low, Michael Rubbo and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Bat, a ball and a boy
results.brief_description: Famous Australian cricketers, including Sir Donald Bradman, Richie Benaud, Ray Lindwall, Len Hutton and Neil Harvey illustrate how to improve a boy’s game from batting to bowling to fielding. Includes archival footage of some of Australia’s greatest players.

results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball strategy for girls
results.creator_credit: Educational Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description: The use of planned strategic play on the basketball court. Demonstrates offensive moves such as fakes, rolls, cuts, variances of pace, the figure eight and defence strategies such as player to player and basic zone, shifting zone, triangle, and diagonal defences.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The University of Cincinnati basketball team demonstrate the fundamentals of dribbling, passing, shooting, body handling and defensive play. Practice and drill on each skill can produce expert players. No other credits available.
